votebox

Class VoteBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • votebox.VoteBox

  • public class VoteBox
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the top level votebox main class. This class organizes and connects the components of VoteBox, namely:
    1) The auditorium network
    2) The vote storage backend
    3) The votebox "middle" (that is, the link between the voter and the backend, the gui)

    • Constructor Detail

      • VoteBox

        public VoteBox()
        Equivalent to new VoteBox(-1).

      • VoteBox

        public VoteBox(int serial)
        Constructs a new instance of a persistent VoteBox booth. This implementation runs in the background, on an auditorium network, and waits to receive an authorization before launching the VoteBox middle. For a standalone implementation, see Launcher.
        Parameters:
        serial - the serial number of the votebox

    • Method Detail

      • broadcastStatus

        public void broadcastStatus()
        Broadcasts this VoteBox booth's status, and resets the status timer

      • getLabel

        public int getLabel()
        Returns this booth's label, assigned by a supervisor over auditorium. If unassigned, will return 0.
        Returns:
        the label

      • getStatus

        public VoteBoxEvent getStatus()
        Returns this booth's status as a VoteBoxEvent, used for periodic broadcasts
        Returns:
        the status

      • registerForLabelChanged

        public void registerForLabelChanged(java.util.Observer obs)
        Allows the VoteBox inactive UI (what is shown when a user isn't voting) to register for a label changed event, and update itself accordingly
        Parameters:
        obs - the observer

      • run

        public void run(java.lang.String location)
        Launch the VoteBox middle. Registers for events that we would want to know about (such as cast ballot, so we can send the message over auditorium)
        Parameters:
        location - the location on disk of the ballot

      • shortCodes

        private void shortCodes(ListExpression ballot,
              java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> raceGroups)
        This method generates a short code for each vote on this machine, which will eventually be sent over the wire to the controller, who will then publish the short code - plaintext pairs and document the nonces generated here so that the votes can be audited and verified
        Parameters:
        ballot - - the ballot containing all of the votes to be short coded

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts Auditorium, registers the listener, and connects to the network.

      • promptForPin

        public void promptForPin(java.lang.String message)
        Initializes a GUI dialog through which the user enters their assigned pin. Returns with no action if already prompting for PIN.
        Parameters:
        message - message displayed as the header of the PIN prompt e.g. "Please Enter Your PIN"

      • validatePin

        public void validatePin(java.lang.String pin)
        Generates a new PINEnteredEvent and sends over the network for validation by supervisor.
        Parameters:
        pin - 4-digit, decimal PIN to be validated

      • renderWriteInImages

        public static void renderWriteInImages(java.lang.String uid,
                       java.lang.String type,
                       java.lang.String... names)
        Renders images for write-in candidates. It gets candidate name(s) from the write-in prompt, along with the corresponding uid (to get the filename) and type (so that this method knows how many names to read), and uses the names to render ballot images for the write-in candidate that contain his/her name.
        Parameters:
        uid - the uid of the candidate
        type - the type of the candidate ("Regular" or "Presidential")
        names - the name(s) of the candidate

      • getCurrentBallotFile

        public java.io.File getCurrentBallotFile()
        A getter method to send the BallotFile to the printer
        Returns:
        _currentBallotFile - the current ballot

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main entry point into the program. If an argument is given, it will be the serial number, otherwise VoteBox will load a serial from its config file.
        Parameters:
        args -
